TopicTitle: Something that's really been getting to me lately.

Articles.Content:
All the mud hate around here is annoying me, so I'm scaling down my mud content to make you happier.

Edited November 12, 2014 by Sun

I'm just gonna say; I hate mud because it gets everywhere and is unavoidable.

Kinda like you.

No offense i'm only joking.

I'm just gonna say; I hate mud because it gets everywhere and is unavoidable.

Kinda like you.

No offense i'm only joking.

*sigh*

@OP:

I'll try to be as polite as possible. No one cares (not a mean tone, more of a fact) about what your opinions on mud are. That means that if you said nothing, we would be quiet in turn. It is only when you bring stuff like this up that we do not have a pleasant reaction.

Bribing us by participating in a thread is not going to go down well either, I believe. I find it borderline trolling.

And on top of all that, this is a Kerbal Space Program forum, not a mud forum. 'Tis just a teensy bit odd.

Edited November 12, 2014 by Starwhip

It's not bribing. It's just me trying to get less mud hate. I'll scale down my mud content, if that can get me less mud hate.

Also, you may want to read my signature.

Edited November 12, 2014 by Sun

It's not bribing. It's just me trying to get less mud hate. I'll scale down my mud content, if that can get me less mud hate.

Also, you may want to read my signature.

Yes, but

this is a Kerbal Space Program forum, not a mud forum.

Here is not the place.

And who hates mud anyways? Most people I know don't go out of their way to set fire to mud puddles...
Multi-User Dungeons are fine. I don't think you'll find much support for them, though. Text based gaming has been out of fashion for a while.

Yes, but

Here is not the place.

And who hates mud anyways? Most people I know don't go out of their way to set fire to mud puddles...

I know it's a KSP forum. But this is the Space Lounge, for non-KSP stuff! Also, the main reason for the mud stuff is to be funny. Even I didn't expect the mud content to get this far.

I know it's a KSP forum. But this is the Space Lounge, for non-KSP stuff! Also, the main reason for the mud stuff is to be funny. Even I didn't expect the mud content to get this far.

Well, you've got me there.

I haven't seen any posts outside of the Space Lounge that pertain to mud, so I guess you're still clean.

Dammit, why did I make that pun?

But don't go spreading it everywhere.

Boots::mud:talkie::toast.
@MrMuddyBoots: While I commend your enthusiasm, I'd like to humbly submit that even the best joke gets a bit stale if it's the only joke you repeat, day in and day out, ad infinitum

I don't think you get what "scaling down" means, MrMuddyBoots. Your avatar, user title, signature, and user name deliver mud to every post you make (though you're probably stuck with the username now). Of your last 20 posts, 13 contain the word "mud" or "boots".

Nobody is saying that you can't talk about mud at all, just limit it to threads about mud, please. Your Muddy Boot picture war is a good place to talk about mud, and users who find your mud thing amusing can go there to enjoy the muddy fun. If someone else starts a thread about mud, it would be appropriate there, too. Just keep it out of non-mud threads and I think everyone will be happy.

Well, a lot of my mud stuff is kinda needed in the other forum games, and considering there are hardly any mud threads here, there would be a lot less posts from me.
Every other user manages to play forum games without mentioning mud all the time, it's not "needed". You could try posting about things that aren't mud. Surely there is more to you than mud?

There is. However, now I consider mud to be part of my forum personality.

I have a bit of a "Forum Personality" as well... I try to be as human as possible here.

Well, at least the wall of text about mud that was your signature is now gone. Progress!

Cognitive dissonance intensifies. I don't want to be too cruel.

How about this. Learn texturing, and make some muddy textures for some of the mods where appropriate. Make them nice though. If you're truly into this you'll put effort into it.

Meh, your "forum personality" is whatever you choose it to be. No one will be disappointed if your personality involves less mud slinging.

That said, I don't really get the "forum personality" thing. Be yourself.
You don't need a forum personality. I'm Modkip, but my username, and most of my posts don't reflect that I love mudkips. Just be yourself
